questions.title: What is respectful communication?
questions.description: Respectful communication is when we listen and respond with kindness, even when we disagree with someone.

questions.question: What do you think is the most important part of respectful communication?

questions.title: Great job!
questions.description: Respectful communication can include listening carefully, taking turns speaking, asking questions, and responding kindly. What are other ways that we can practice respectful communication?

questions.question: You should interrupt someone when they are speaking.

questions.title: False!
questions.description: You shouldn't interrupt someone when they are talking, even if you are excited or disagree with what they're saying. Instead, try to listen carefully and speak when it is your turn.

questions.question: When someone is speaking, you should think about what you want for dinner.

questions.title: False!
questions.description: When someone is speaking, you should pay attention and show your interest. You can do this by nodding, smiling, asking questions, and making eye-contact. Try not to think about anything else...even if it's what you want for dinner!

questions.title: Let's practice!
questions.description: Let's practice respectful communication! Remember, we should listen and respond with kindness - even when we disagree with someone!

questions.title: Meet Sanjay and Maya!
questions.description: One Saturday morning, Sanjay visits Maya. For lunch, Maya's father offers to make soup. Sanjay shouts, “Hooray! Let’s make soup with mushrooms! I love -” Maya interrupts him, “Ewww, no! I hate mushrooms!"

questions.question: What should Sanjay and Maya do differently?

choices.answer: Maya should let Sanjay finish before speaking
Sanjay should just let Maya pick the soup

questions.title: Maya should let Sanjay finish before speaking!
questions.description: Maya should listen while Sanjay is speaking. When he is finished, then she can respond (respectfully, of course!). This shows Sanjay that she cares about his opinion, too.

questions.question: How should Maya respond to Sanjay?

choices.answer: "I actually don't like mushrooms...can we leave them out?"
"If you like mushrooms, we can't be friends anymore."
"This is my house, so I get to choose!"

questions.title: "I actually don't like mushrooms..."
questions.description: After Sanjay is done speaking, Maya might say, "I actually don't like mushrooms...can we leave them out?" Maybe she can let him pick the dessert instead!

questions.title: Back to Sanjay and Maya!
questions.description: Maya tells Sanjay that someone at school is spreading an embarrassing rumor about her. Sanjay wasn't paying attention, and asks her if they can play a game because he's bored.

questions.question: What should Sanjay and Maya do differently?

choices.answer: Sanjay should pay attention when Maya is sharing something
Maya should start a rumor about Sanjay instead
Sanjay should find someone else to play with him
Maya should shout next time so Sanjay hears her

questions.title: Sanjay should pay attention to Maya!
questions.description: Sanjay should pay attention when Maya is sharing something, especially when it's personal or sensitive. He should listen carefully and respond with kindness to show that he cares about her.

questions.question: How should Sanjay respond to Maya?

choices.answer: "I understand that you're feeling sad. I'm here for you."
"Let's go start a rumor about someone else."

questions.title: "I understand that you're feeling sad..."
questions.description: Sanjay might tell Maya, "I understand you're feeling sad. I'm here for you." He can also ask how he can help, and let her know that he supports her.

questions.title: Take a moment to pause and reflect
questions.description: Think about a time when you didn't listen or respond to someone with kindness. What would you do differently next time?

questions.title: You are a superstar!
questions.description: Sometimes, it can be hard to communicate respectfully, like when we are feeling excited or we disagree with someone. But we should still try to listen and respond with kindness -- and then we can share our thoughts and ideas too!
